ratings.comment: Prof. Ely is great. Lectures are generally interesting and Dr.Ely is very knowledgeable. LIS202 with Ely is a very easy A class. If you show up and do all of the assignments you will get an A.

The class is an easy A. He noticed people weren't showing up and stopped posting the slides until the following week so that you couldn't do the weekly assignments without attending lecture, so just show up and you'll be fine. The 3 news article papers, 1 ai paper, and the final paper were easy. Could clearly tell his stance on political issues.

The class is an easy A, very little work... 4 papers, weekly discussion prep/takeaways, and a weekly quiz. Lectures are extremely boring and not worth going to as you can get an A without going. He reads exactly what it says on the slides which you can find online. Lots of guest speakers which can be interesting but are often unrelated to the class

Ely is a really good professor. Attend class, read, do the weekly homework and you will pass. This class talks about social issues we should be having more conversations about, which I loved. Take this class with an open-mind.

Professor Ely is amazing! I took this class to fill my ethnic studies requirement and I'm so glad I did. There are weekly readings and questions/a short quiz based on them. There are no exams, only a few papers. The material is definitely worth paying attention to. Put some thought into understanding the concepts & you'll get an A.

I took LIS 202 to fulfill my ethnic studies requirement, and I learned a lot more invaluable information than I was initially expecting as a STEM major. The course itself is easy but does require more effort in paper analyses. The actual content of the course, however, can be sensitive and controversial, so be sure to maintain an open mind!
Professor Ely's class is really chill and interesting. I'm really glad I took this course to fulfill my ethnic study requirement.

Eric is an awesome guy! Attendance is required but the class is actually worth it to go. He structured the semester very nicely and you're guaranteed an A if you show up, participate, and do the little work that is assigned. You have weekly readings and quizzes, a few writing assignments, and no exams! 10/10 recommend having Jacquie has your TA too

LIS202 is really a good course for STEM people to get credits! The reading seems to be a lot but skimming through them is enough. All essays are graded very loosely in a sense that you pass the word count you get full credit. There are no exams. Eric's lectures are well delivered. By all means, this is an easy course worth taking.

Professor Ely was one of the most understanding professors I have had so far in college. Attendance is taken during lecture and discussion section and you receive a participation grade at the end of the semester based on your attendance. No exams or final just writing assignments and 2 point quizzes. There are lots of opportunities for extra credit

Interesting topics, but the lectures are extremely boring. He is very understanding, but he's not a great lecturer because he read off of the slides for the first half of the semester. He got better by the end, but his class and the discussion sections were a snooze fest. Pretty easy essays/quizzes, take this class if you want an easy A.

LIS 202 had to have been my favorite class this semester. The material was super engaging, and Professor Ely was super lenient. There are three main assignments due each week, but they're super easy. He only had 4 bigger assignments, but they were super short and easy to do if you follow the rubric and attend office hours. Show up, do the work, A.
Very kind professor, and explains things clearly.

Long as you show up to discussions and complete all the assignments, you are pretty much guaranteed an A. Professor Ely is a nice, caring professor and he teaches topics that you will carry with you for life.

Eric was a really caring guy and was very educated about the class content. I really appreciated his acknowledgment of his ethnicity and privileges before discussing racial topics or cultural inequalities. No exams and very clear grading. Attending class and sharing genuine responses will get you an excellent grade.

Erik is a really respectful person. He's a little bit nervous, but it's okay because the class is really well organized and his lectures are good. There are NO EXAMS. Attendance is worth a good amount, and he uses "Top Hat" to conduct polls during class. Overall just a really nice guy. If you do all the assignments you'll do great in this class!
